meanings.definition: To incorrectly assess or evaluate the worth or value of something.
meanings.sent1: She misrated the movie, thinking it was boring when it was actually exciting.
meanings.sent2: The teacher misrated the student's essay, giving it a lower grade than it deserved.
meanings.sent3: He misrated the new restaurant, believing it was terrible just because of one bad dish.
meanings.sent4: The detective misrated the suspect's innocence, leading to a wrongful arrest.
meanings.sent5: The weather forecast misrated the storm's intensity, causing unexpected damage.

meanings.definition: To give a lower or higher rating than deserved.
meanings.sent1: The critic misrated the book, giving it a higher score than it truly earned.
meanings.sent2: They misrated the hotel, awarding it only one star despite its excellent service.
meanings.sent3: The judge misrated the talent show performance, unfairly favoring one contestant.
meanings.sent4: The app misrated the restaurant, suggesting it was top-rated when it had poor reviews.
meanings.sent5: The customer misrated the product, believing it was overpriced when it was actually a great deal.

meanings.sent1: She misrated the situation, assuming it was dangerous when it was completely safe.
meanings.sent2: The manager misrated the employee's skills, underestimating their true abilities.
meanings.sent3: He misrated the quiz difficulty, thinking it was easy until he saw the questions.
meanings.sent4: The historian misrated the artifact's age, mistakenly dating it to a different era.
meanings.sent5: The artist misrated the art piece, believing it was amateurish when it was actually profound.
